introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• One of the earliest known printed cookbooks, De honesta voluptate, was written by Bartolomeo Platina in the 15th century.
• It combined culinary recipes with discussions of diet, health, and moral philosophy.
• It helped popularize certain Italian dishes across Europe.
• Platina drew on local and regional traditions to emphasize fresh ingredients and balanced meals.
• Scholars see the work as a snapshot of Renaissance food culture.
question: The student wants to emphasize the influence De honesta voluptate had beyond just recipes. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Platina wrote the 15th-century cookbook De honesta voluptate, which compiled numerous recipes.
B: Some scholars consider De honesta voluptate a fascinating glimpse into Renaissance culinary traditions.
C: De honesta voluptate not only provided recipes but also included dietary, health, and moral guidance that spread Italian dishes throughout Europe.
D: Bartolomeo Platina’s cookbook popularized many fresh ingredients and balanced meals in the 15th century.
explanation: Choice C captures the cookbook’s broader cultural impact by highlighting its combination of moral/philosophical content with recipes, which helped spread Italian cuisine across Europe.
